intro: Lysiloma cuernavacanum, commonly known as the Cuernavaca thornapple, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a hardened capsule. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
